label: Person
comment: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

properties.label: additionalName
properties.comment: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

properties.label: address
properties.comment: Physical address of the item.

properties.label: affiliation
properties.comment: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

properties.label: alumniOf
properties.comment: An organization that the person is an alumni of. Inverse property: alumni.

properties.label: award
properties.comment: An award won by or for this item. Supersedes awards.

properties.label: birthDate
properties.comment: Date of birth.

properties.label: birthPlace
properties.comment: The place where the person was born.

properties.label: brand
properties.comment: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

properties.label: children
properties.comment: A child of the person.

properties.label: colleague
properties.comment: A colleague of the person. Supersedes colleagues.

properties.label: contactPoint
properties.comment: A contact point for a person or organization. Supersedes contactPoints.

properties.label: deathDate
properties.comment: Date of death.

properties.label: deathPlace
properties.comment: The place where the person died.

properties.label: duns
properties.comment: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

properties.label: email
properties.comment: Email address.

properties.label: familyName
properties.comment: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

properties.label: faxNumber
properties.comment: The fax number.

properties.label: follows
properties.comment: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

properties.label: funder
properties.comment: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

properties.label: gender
properties.comment: Gender of the person. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

properties.label: givenName
properties.comment: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

properties.label: globalLocationNumber
properties.comment: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

properties.label: hasCredential
properties.comment: A credential awarded to the Person or Organization.

properties.label: hasOccupation
properties.comment: The Person's occupation. For past professions, use Role for expressing dates.

properties.label: hasOfferCatalog
properties.comment: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

properties.label: hasPOS
properties.comment: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

properties.label: height
properties.comment: The height of the item.

properties.label: homeLocation
properties.comment: A contact location for a person's residence.

properties.label: honorificPrefix
properties.comment: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

properties.label: honorificSuffix
properties.comment: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

properties.label: isicV4
properties.comment: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

properties.label: jobTitle
properties.comment: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

properties.label: knows
properties.comment: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

properties.label: knowsAbout
properties.comment: Of a Person, and less typically of an Organization, to indicate a topic that is known about - suggesting possible expertise but not implying it. We do not distinguish skill levels here, or relate this to educational content, events, objectives or JobPosting descriptions.

properties.label: knowsLanguage
properties.comment: Of a Person, and less typically of an Organization, to indicate a known language. We do not distinguish skill levels or reading/writing/speaking/signing here. Use language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.

properties.label: makesOffer
properties.comment: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person. Inverse property: offeredBy.

properties.label: memberOf
properties.comment: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs. Inverse property: member.

properties.label: naics
properties.comment: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

properties.label: nationality
properties.comment: Nationality of the person.

properties.label: netWorth
properties.comment: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

properties.label: owns
properties.comment: Products owned by the organization or person.

properties.label: parent
properties.comment: A parent of this person. Supersedes parents.

properties.label: performerIn
properties.comment: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

properties.label: publishingPrinciples
properties.comment:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

properties.label: relatedTo
properties.comment: The most generic familial relation.

properties.label: seeks
properties.comment: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

properties.label: sibling
properties.comment: A sibling of the person. Supersedes siblings.

properties.label: sponsor
properties.comment: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

properties.label: spouse
properties.comment: The person's spouse.

properties.label: taxID
properties.comment: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

properties.label: telephone
properties.comment: The telephone number.

properties.label: vatID
properties.comment: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

properties.label: weight
properties.comment: The weight of the product or person.

properties.label: workLocation
properties.comment: A contact location for a person's place of work.

properties.label: worksFor
properties.comment: Organizations that the person works for.

properties.label: additionalType
properties.comment: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

properties.label: alternateName
properties.comment: An alias for the item.

properties.label: description
properties.comment: A description of the item.

properties.label: disambiguatingDescription
properties.comment: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

properties.label: identifier
properties.comment: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

properties.label: image
properties.comment: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

properties.label: mainEntityOfPage
properties.comment: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity.

properties.label: name
properties.comment: The name of the item.

properties.label: potentialAction
properties.comment: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

properties.label: sameAs
properties.comment: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

properties.label: subjectOf
properties.comment: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing. Inverse property: about.

properties.label: url
properties.comment: URL of the item.
